SupportingTexts.HomePageText: Run and explore DocuSign code examples with Authorization Code Grant or JWT Grant authentication
SupportingTexts.SearchFailed: The examples with this text could not be found. Please, modify the search field.
SupportingTexts.CFRError: This example is not compatible with your CFR Part 11 account. Please return to the homepage to run one of the examples that is compatible or authenticate with a different account.
SupportingTexts.ContactSupportToEnableFeature: Please contact support to enable {0} in your account

LoginPage.LoginHeader: Please Authenticate with DocuSign
LoginPage.LoginHelperText: You need to authenticate with DocuSign to continue your request.

SelectAPIPage.SelectAPIHeader: Please choose an API type

HelpingTexts.EmailWontBeShared: We'll never share your email with anyone else.
HelpingTexts.PhoneNumberWontBeShared: We'll never share your phone number with anyone else.
HelpingTexts.CCEmailShouldDifferFromSigner: The email for the cc recipient must be different from the signer's email.
HelpingTexts.AccessCodeText: Provide this string to a recipient that is different such as in person or by mail or via a different email.
HelpingTexts.CountryCodeText: The country code for the phone number below.
HelpingTexts.PhoneNumberWillBeNotified: This phone number will receive a notification.
HelpingTexts.DynamicContentValue: Provide values for the dynamic content fields shown on the elastic template agreement.
HelpingTexts.DynamicContentNote: Note: The elastic template must be manually modified through the elastic templates UI to include these dynamic content fields.
HelpingTexts.EmbedClickwrapURL: Agreement URL returned in the JSON response:
HelpingTexts.SaveAgentActivationCode: Save this code. You'll need it when activating the new agent.
HelpingTexts.EmailAddressOfUserToDelete: The email address of the user whose data will be deleted. Note that this email address should be associated with a user that has been closed for 24 hours.
HelpingTexts.UserIDOfUserToDelete: The user ID of the user whose data will be deleted. Note that this ID should be associated with a user that has been closed for 24 hours.

Examples.ExampleName: Send an envelope with a remote (email) signer and cc recipient
Examples.ExampleDescription: The envelope includes a pdf, Word, and HTML document. Anchor text(AutoPlace) is used to position the signing fields in the documents.
Examples.ResultsPageText:
The envelope has been created and sent!
Envelope ID {0}.

Examples.ExampleName: Send an envelope using a template
Examples.ExampleDescription: The envelope is defined by the template. The signer and cc recipient name and email are used to fill in the template's roles.

RedirectsToOtherCodeExamples.RedirectText: Prerequisite: Please first create the template using Create a template.

Examples.ExampleName: Request a signature by email with document generation
Examples.ExampleDescription: Creates an envelope from a template with a document that is dynamically generated to include all the customized data specified by the sender.

Examples.ExampleName: Request a signature by SMS or WhatsApp delivery
Examples.ExampleDescription: Sends a signature request via an SMS or WhatsApp message.
Examples.ResultsPageText:
The envelope has been created and sent!

Examples.ExampleName: Request a signature through your app (embedded signing)
Examples.ExampleDescription: Sends an envelope, then uses embedded signing for the first signer. With embedded signing, DocuSign signing is initiated from your website.

Examples.ExampleName: Request a signature through your app (embedded signing) with a CFR Part 11 account
Examples.ExampleDescription: Sends an envelope, then uses embedded signing with recipient authentication by phone for the first signer. With embedded signing, DocuSign signing is initiated from your website.

Examples.ExampleName: Embedded Signing Ceremony from a template with an added document
Examples.ExampleDescription:
This example sends an envelope based on a template.

In addition to the template's document(s), the example adds an additional document to the envelope by using the Composite Templates feature.

RedirectsToOtherCodeExamples.RedirectText: Prerequisite: Please first create the template using Create a template.

Forms.FormName: The template you created via Create a template will be used.

Examples.ExampleName: Request a signature using focused view
Examples.ExampleDescription: Sends an envelope, then uses focused view for the signer.
Examples.ResultsPageText: The document has been embedded with focused view.

Examples.ExampleName: Send an envelope to an In Person Signer
Examples.ExampleDescription: Demonstrates how to host an In Person Signing session with embedded signing.

Examples.ExampleName: Send an envelope with an order form and payment field
Examples.ExampleDescription: Anchor text (AutoPlace) is used to position the fields in the documents.
Examples.Notes: Note: This example will only work if the sender's DocuSign account is set up with a DocuSign payment gateway. Since the Payment Gateway ID is set in the configuration file, you will need to run your own instance of this project to set it.

RedirectsToOtherCodeExamples.RedirectText: Prerequisite: Please set the DS_PAYMENT_GATEWAY_ID value in the configuration file.

Examples.ExampleName: Send an envelope using binary document transfer
Examples.ExampleDescription:
The envelope includes a pdf, Word, and HTML document.

Multipart data transfer is used to send the documents in binary format to DocuSign. Binary transfer is 33% more efficient than base64 encoding and is recommended for documents over 15M Bytes. Binary transfer is not yet supported by the SDK.
Examples.ResultsPageText:
The envelope has been created and sent!
Envelope ID {0}.

Examples.ExampleName: Share access to a DocuSign envelope inbox

AdditionalPage.Name: authenticate_as_agent
AdditionalPage.ResultsPageText: Please go to the principal's developer account at admindemo.docusign.com and log out, then come back to this page and press continue. You will be redirected to the log in page where you should authenticate as the agent user that you just created.

AdditionalPage.Name: list_status_successful
AdditionalPage.ResultsPageText:
Go to the Manage tab in the agent's DocuSign developer account, select shared access in the upper left, then select the principal's account to view the principal's envelopes. For details, see How to share access to a DocuSign inbox.

Results from Envelopes:listStatus method:

AdditionalPage.Name: list_status_unsuccessful
AdditionalPage.ResultsPageText: The principal user's account does not have any envelopes in it. Please log out of the launcher and log in as a principal user and create an envelope.

AdditionalPage.Name: user_not_found
AdditionalPage.ResultsPageText: User has not been activated. Please go to the agent's email to activate the agent.

AdditionalPage.ResultsPageText: First the launcher will create a new template in your account that will be used to create the web form.

AdditionalPage.Name: create_web_form
AdditionalPage.ResultsPageText: Go to your DocuSign account to create the Web Form. Go to 'Forms' in your developer account, select 'New,' and choose 'Upload web form.' Upload the JSON config file 'web-form-config.json' found under the demo_documents folder of this project. You will need to activate the web form before proceeding. Press Continue after doing so.
